trustfund:
TF029799-FRY - FINANCIAL SECTOR
            DEVELOPMENT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the Financial Sector
            Development Technical Assistance Grant Project for Serbia
            and Montenegro were as follows: the outcome was highly
            satisfactory, the sustainability was highly likely, the
            institutional development impact was substantial, and the
            Bank and borrower performance were both satisfactory.
            Lessons learned: the project design reflected best practice
            lessons from the Bank's prior operations in ECA,
            tailored to Serbian environment. Technical assistance in
            support of politically difficult transition reforms have a
            higher chance of success if designed as an integral part of
            Bank's broader sector assistance strategy. The
            implementation of a complex and politically sensitive
            Technical Assistance (TA) program does not only require a
            fully functioning implementing agency, but also constant
            support at the level of senior policy-making. The effective
            coordination by the Bank of technical assistance provided by
            bilateral donors can be a critical factor in quickly
            developing the institutional capacity to implement high
            impact reforms. Flexibility built into the TA operations is
            essential when dealing with rapidly evolving operational
            environment. Creating efficient institutional arrangements
            is a critical factor for implementing the complex technical
            assistance program.
